alert.note: Alert for Forest; Venango (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 01 at 5:58PM EDT until June 01 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northeastern Venango County in northwestern Pennsylvania... West central Forest County in northwestern Pennsylvania... * Until 630 PM EDT. * At 558 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 7 miles south of Titusville, or 7 miles north of Oil City, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Oil City around 610 PM EDT. Tionesta around 630 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Rouseville, Hasson Heights, Oil Creek State Park and Woodland Heights. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
